item.description:
This is my admittedly weird idea for modelling consciousness as an objective, 3rd person thing (which of course it's not, but there you go). I presented a poster on it at the 2006 Tucson meeting on the Science of Consciousness. It didn't really go anywhere from there, so since we're wrapping up the group, I figured why not.

I can't seem to attach a file to this meeting posting, so I'll upload it into the "FILES" section of our group.

See you there!
item.how_to_find_us: Enter side entrance, some up to 5th floor. It's on the BU campus, so if door is locked, my mobile is 617-981-1646

group.name: The Boston Philosophy of Mind Group

item.name: Hard Problem Again: Sean's poster at the 2006 Tucson meeting
